title: Pat McGrath (Tipperary hurler)
text:
Pat McGrath (born 1961) is an Irish retired <a href="hurling">hurler</a> and <a href="Gaelic%20football">Gaelic football</a>er. His league and championship career with the <a href="Tipperary%20GAA">Tipperary</a> senior teams in both codes spanned nine seasons from 1981 to 1989. 
Born in <a href="Loughmore">Loughmore</a>, <a href="County%20Tipperary">County Tipperary</a>, McGrath was raised in a family that had a strong affinity for <a href="Gaelic%20games">Gaelic games</a>. His father, Mick McGrath, and his uncles, enjoyed <a href="Tipperary%20Senior%20Football%20Championship">county championship</a> success with the <a href="Loughmore-Castleiney%20GAA">Loughmore-Castleiney</a> club in the 1950s.
McGrath attended <a href="Rockwell%20College">Rockwell College</a> while simultaneously coming to prominence at juvenile and underage levels with the Loughmore-Casteiney teams. As a <a href="dual%20player">dual player</a> at senior level, he won a total of five county championship medals.
McGrath made his debut on the inter-county scene at the age of sixteen when he was selected for both Tipperary minor teams. He enjoyed three championship seasons as a dual player with the minor teams before subsequently joining the under-21 teams with whom he won back-to-back <a href="All-Ireland%20Under-21%20Hurling%20Championship">All-Ireland</a> medals in 1980 and 1981. By this stage Ryan had also joined the Tipperary senior hurling team, before later joining the Tipperary senior football team. McGrath won his sole <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">All-Ireland</a> medal in 1989, having earlier collected a <a href="Munster%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">Munster</a> medal.
McGrath's sons, <a href="Noel%20McGrath%20%28hurler%29">Noel</a> and <a href="John%20McGrath%20%28Tipperary%20hurler%29">John</a>, are also All-Ireland medal winners with Tipperary.
